Dispute_Type: Dispute over performance appraisal and its fairness as per MOU terms
Legal_Issue: Was the ADM's decision to deny the grievance reasonable under the standard of review?
Evidence_Assessment: ADM considered the MOU and concluded the PREA process was fair; global rating remained unchanged
Legal_Rule: Standard of review for administrative decisions is reasonableness unless correctness is required by law
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged unfairness in performance appraisal process
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: PREA process found to be fair
Key_Evidence_Considered: MOU, performance appraisal records, PREA process documentation
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to denial of grievance regarding performance appraisal
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law standard of review principles
Defendant_Response: ADM maintained decision based on MOU and fairness of process
Applicable_Process: Grievance procedure under MOU, followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: Reasonableness standard in administrative decision review
